section.name: Enterprise Java (605.784.31) Root
section.p:
This is the course home page for the Enterprise Java Course (605.784), taught at John's Hopkins University, Engineering Programs for Professionals. This site will be populated as the semester progresses and topics are addressed. If you are looking for a version of the full content for ejava-javaee, refer to
http://webdev.apl.jhu.edu/~jcs/legacy-ejava-javaee.

ul.li: read through project description and post any clarification questions
design your project business objects within the "BO" project areas; provide unit tests
create the schema file for the project; to mature over time
create the structure of the JDBC eLeague Ingest DAO within the "DAO" project; to mature over time
build your project from the root; all supplied artifacts should build and test correctly
went through JDBC tutorial and used this project to try out any test JDBC code you had questions on
performed a sample JDBC O/R Mapping with CLUB, VENUE, and ADDRESS tables to Club and Venue Java classes
registered for newsgroup and setup e-mail handling (all e-mails will have ejava_class in subject)
posted at least 1 test message to newsgroup
setup development environment by going through exercises 0 and 1
